title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
3 points maximum

· Axes correctly labeled

· Axes correctly scaled

· Data correctly plotted as a bar graph with pH as the independent variable
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the following points.

· Axes correctly labeled

· Axes correctly scaled

· Data correctly plotted as a bar graph with pH as the independent variable

Student response earns one of the following points.

· Axes correctly labeled

· Axes correctly scaled

· Data correctly plotted as a bar graph with pH as the independent variable

Student response earns two of the following points.

· Axes correctly labeled

· Axes correctly scaled

· Data correctly plotted as a bar graph with pH as the independent variable

Student response earns three of the following points.

· Axes correctly labeled

· Axes correctly scaled

· Data correctly plotted as a bar graph with pH as the independent variable

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
3 points maximum
Estimated (1 point)

· Optimal pH of enzyme is 7 OR greater than 5 and less than 9

Explanation (2 points maximum)

Evidence (1 point)

· Reaction at the optimal pH value has the highest absorbance/ amount of product produced

· Other pH values had lower absorbance/produce less product

Justification (1 point)
A change in pH...

· alters the structure of the enzyme’s active site and reduces its

· alters the charge of R-groups and reduces the enzyme’s activity

· disrupts substrate binding and/or catalytic mechanism and reduces

· denatures the enzyme and reduces its activity

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

· Control Treatment: Reaction without enzyme
Description: Confirms enzyme is necessary

· Control Treatment: Reaction with denatured enzyme
Description: Confirms active enzyme is necessary

· Control Treatment: Reaction under anaerobic conditions (no oxygen)
Description: Confirms oxygen is necessary.

· Control Treatment: Reaction without catechol
Description: Confirms catechol is necessary
descriptions:
Student earns none of the following points.

· Control Treatment: Reaction without enzyme
Description: Confirms enzyme is necessary

· Control Treatment: Reaction with denatured enzyme
Description: Confirms active enzyme is necessary

· Control Treatment: Reaction under anaerobic conditions (no oxygen)
Description: Confirms oxygen is necessary.

· Control Treatment: Reaction without catechol
Description: Confirms catechol is necessary

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

Prediction:

· Fruit will not brown

Justification

· Browning requires a functional enzyme.

Prediction

· Fruit will brown more slowly
Justification

· The reaction occurs spontaneously but more slowly without enzyme.

· Enzyme reduces activation energy.
descriptions:
Student earns none of the following points.

Prediction:

· Fruit will not brown

Justification

· Browning requires a functional enzyme.

Prediction

· Fruit will brown more slowly
Justification

· The reaction occurs spontaneously but more slowly without enzyme.

· Enzyme reduces activation energy.
